name: Cthulhu Saves the World
description: The lord of insanity, Cthulhu was all set to plunge the world into insanity and destruction when his powers were sealed by a mysterious sorcerer. The only way for him to break the curse is to become a true hero. Save the world to destroy it in an epic parody RPG journey of redemption, romance, and insanity!
minimum_requirements: OS:  Windows XP, Vista, 7 Processor:  1.6Ghz or higher Memory: 1GB Hard Disk Space:  200 Video Card:  DirectX 9.0c compatible DirectX®:  9.0c compatible Sound: DirectX 9.0c compatible Additional: Current version of Windows Media Player

reviews.review_text: Do you enjoy self-deprecating, hilarious, JRPG-inspired, 8-bit games? Have you ever wanted to be so nefariously evil, that you will go so far as to save the world in order to reign over it? Are you friends with a sentient, talking sword?  Then Cthulhu Saves the World is just right for you!  This game is great. Buy it.

The music of this game and the funny plot where characters insult each other, and the funny descriptions for each of the monsters truly make this game an enjoyable experience to play. It's 8 Bit / 16 bit joy that will remind you why retro systems were so fun back in the day and the funny translations of RPG Games, except this is original user generated content.  Its only a couple of bucks for the game but it often goes on sale for next to nothing. If I had the chance I would pay at least $9.99 for it. It's very entertaining. Just be sure to initiate lots of random battles to beat the boss in each scenario. The further you get the harder you have to think because the screen layouts become more complex.

I may have only played an hour and a half of this game so far but I am really enjoying it. I'm chuckling heaps :). I'd probably take this game in small doses as the constant battles got a bit monotonous for me near the end of an hour. I've had no problem with the game and my laptop's pretty slow and handles it just fine which is awesome. It's also a pretty game.

i'll make little review after finish this game Pro +Classic RPG +So many character in your party +Badass cthulchu +The story is so funy! lol +Honest director lol +Description monster so creative  Cons -Repetitive dungeon -The background of character is not clear -Simple storyline  after all i'm very enjoy play this game. and the conlclusion... for me this game can get score 7/10

As a big fan of old JRPGs, I just knew I would enjoy this game. While the game is rather short, the story is enough fun to make up for that. Also amusing are the descriptions of each enemy, many of which contain a reference to some other game or movie, or what-have-you. I would only not recommend this game if you're not a fan of turn-based combat.
So, Chtulhu, a fangirl seawitch, a talking sword, an emo chick and an alien cat walk into a bar...

Pros: - entertaining characters - cute - THERE'S A GREEN SPACE KITTY NAMED PAWS - great introduction to 8-bit RPGs - fun quests  Cons: - sooo many enemies spawning - like all over - and that's the only con  In all seriousness, and as a fan of the Lovecraft stories, I was expecting this to be a dorky little RPG with no real story. However, the more I played the game, the more I started enjoying it and really loving it. It's a fun way to spend an afternoon, and some of the bosses are really quite hard to pass. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a lot of fun with no real thought!
what more can say CTHULHU SAVES THE DAMN WORLD ITS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Cthulu Saves The World is a more polished version of Breath Of Death VII with a lot more Humor and actual storyline, it even has decent gameplay. If you like old school RPGs and are looking for a good laugh then this is the game for you. Has around 7-10 hours of gameplay which definitely meets the price, you can even get it on sales for 0,50 with Breath Of Death Included. 6/10
If you like H.P Lovecraft you will enjoy this game. Enable the commentary from the makers as well. It's pretty good.

A parody of Lovecraft's masterpieces. It tries to be fun, tries too hard sometimes.  If you can bear with the spoiler amount in the title itself, I can summarize the topic as an evil thing loses its powers and tries to regain them by trying to be a nice guy once in a while. A santa with alzheimer, A mermaid with legs, A kitty who is actually an alien, and a hovering sword comes to his help. I did not finish the game yet, I am about to, but I dont think the other characters will be exceptions in terms of weirdness of the cast. Not really well thought or something, and mostly just interesting for the sake of being interesting. The story revolves around our hero, there are some 4th wall breaking moments etc. But actually let alone a few interesting lines in the graveyard, writing gets dull too easily.   Do we need such a title? Parody is basically a thing which is pointed towards too overrated things. At least that is what I am used to. Lovecraft is one of the milestones for western horror genre, if not one of the founding fathers. Nobody reads him too much, nobody mentions him too much, and in gaming, in movies, in books etc, actually if there is a thing, it is underrepresentation. So what is the point of taking a demigod from his book, and ridiculing him? I am not sure.  I am playing this with developer commentary. He seems like a fun guy. I enjoyed my time with him. And I actually think that this notes could be included in Narrator versus Cthulhu dialogue lines. A missed opportunity.  Music is mediocre. Good for a while, gets repetitive too fast. Does not get annoying. Nothing to shame upon, nothing to praise.  Okay, so what about gameplay. I am not that familiar with this kind of RPG titles, so my comments would be coming from a rookie in this genre. But I seriously dont think that having an algorithm as simple as the following for winning is a good sign:  -Press enter repetitively until all of your enemies die or one of your guys get about to die. -Heal, if there are more than half remaining, nuke two or three times. -Repeat.  RPG side is a bit lacking. With each level, you choose an ability out of two for each character. The maximum level is 30. So There are 2^30 'setups' for each character. This is not as good as it sounds, since most of the upgrades are just basic stat upgrades. Mechanics of the game is not well explained, I still did not understand what is making them insane is doing. I dont know whether water attacks work more against fire-like enemies. I am not sure what each Stat is doing, but I am only guessing. And enemy explanations are nothing more than 'witty-oneliners', so there are a lot of missing things here.  Other than that, getting interrupted by random encounters is just too disorienting for my tastes. I played Pokemon before, so I know that this is WAD, but I think experiencing this to the point of forgetting where was I in levels with labirynthine designs with no minimap, remembering it in some 10 seconds, then getting disrupted again... Till getting angry, is no good design.  There are potions. They resurrect or fully heal your party members. Especially for the Ape Princess, use of it is definitely needed. There are enough weapon finds out in the wild, so I did not spend almost any money. Imbalance? I think so.There is a 1UP mechanics which helps u to ressurrect at the same point....But I did not use it as well. Since it basically works like an autosave feature, but a limited one, so instead of using it, I just kept saving and reloading (savescumming) almost infinitely. Since most of the fights were pressing enter repeatedly, not saving does not help the feeling of thrill, only frustration. So 1up was a mechanism which is meaningless. Items were kinda ok, and they allowed flexibility in pressing enter countlessly strategies.  Most of the boss fights were just holding on type wars. Nothing is different except they got 20000 HP this time. Have 1 or 2 healer, nuke until done. A dumb but sadly a valid strategy for almost all of them.  If I were not obsessed about finishing the games I started, I would ve abandoned this borefest waaaay too earlier than this. I pushed myself to enjoy it, I am at about 8/10 of the game now, and I guess I will finish it in 1-2 days time. But I wanted to warn all fellow gamers that, times have changed, and being retro is not a virtue of its own. So I am writing this review after I became sure that this will continue like this.  Writing may be interesting for some, but if I want to read a good story, and only that, I should not be using Steam for that.

As an ardent Lovecraft and RPG fan, I whole-heartedly recommend this game.  If you're familiar with Breath of Death VII, then you already know what this game is like. If you're not, read on...  CSTW is a light-hearted homage to both the classic JRPG's of yesteryear as well as H.P. Lovecrafts work. In this game, you play as Cthulu, cosmic horror supreme, who undergoes a bit of a dilemma: rather than destroying the world, Cthulu is tasked with saving it (hence the name.) Along the way, Cthulu encounters many different characters and locales, many of which are pulled straight from Lovecraft's stories. Some help and join you, while most just want to fight.  As for the core gameplay, it's traditional turn-based RPG fare. You choose your options, watch everything unfold, and go for it again. There are plenty of characters to mix and match for your active party, all of which obtain their own unique skills and abilites. The level-up system from BoDVII is back, giving players a choice in how they want to build their characters upon gaining a level. Simple, but it adds a nice sense of strategy. The good ol' 'stand next to a save point and grind out all of the battles in an area until they're gone' strategy is still the best way to break the game, so that's nice.  Overall, the game is fun and quirky. It's not very deep, and especially with the Diablo III's and Skyrim's and WoW's out today, CSTW might seem a little too simple. But RPG's started somewhere and this game does a fine job at looking back lovingly.  If you're a fan of either classic RPG's or Lovecraft, this is a solid buy.

When I first got Cthulhu Saves The World, it just sat in my library. I was unsure on whether or not it was my kind of game, then I started playing it and i was pleasantly surprised by how good it was. Right off the bat, the game is funny, enjoyable and addictive. 10/10 would recommend to anyone looking for a cheap, well made, well written game.
This is one of the better RPG Maker games out there.  The writing is great and very humorous. The game is solid. The 8-bit presentation works.  8/10

This game is the reason why I love indie JRPG's. Its funny, engaging, and visually attractive. The controls are tight and it doesn't feel like the many JRPG's that are out there. Only problem is battles can feel repetitive sometimes, which is a big problem with most JRPG's. If you like elder gods and RPG's then this game is for you.
I fought a unicorn as Cthulhu. 10/10

This has been a very entertaining game. The characters are more than just bland set-pieces, and the game itself reminds me VERY heavily of the older days. The 'humor' is indeed very humorous, and that combined with the game's roster,cutscene style and the ability to 'Chat' with your party members throughout the game very much makes me think of the old Phantasy Star series.   9//10
Definitely a must-have if you like oldschool RPG's. The game has a good story-line, good soundtrack and a very good dialogue, it is extremely hilarious at times and well-written.  10/10
It should be called 'Cthulhu Get the ♥♥♥♥♥es'

Well, it's been awhile. Grandpa was having problems with his ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Yes, it seems something got up there and Grandpa found out about it in his latest prostate exam.  This game is about one of Grandpa's childhood friends. Although in those days he was quite a rabble rouser, now apparently he has decided to not cause trouble anymore and fly the straight and narrow. I'm proud of him. I remember it like it was just yesterday, Grandpa and Cthulu would go around town leaving bags of flaming dog poop on doorsteps, we loved hitting Principal McKeeny's house.  Billy doesn't understand what all the fuss is about, but that's because he is on vacation in Greece.

Go read my review for Breath of Death VII. Now imagine they improved that game to the point of it actually being similar to a real, bonafide RPG that's genuinely fun and playable. Then you've got an idea of how fun this game is.

As an avid reader of H.P. Lovecraft, this was hilarious. Lots of references and jokes about his novella all over. Not reading any of his novella may remove from some of the comedy, but it would still be rather hilarious if you didn't! It's not only hilarious, but really fun! Earthbound-esque dungeons(Easy to get lost in, and no real way to easily find where you have to go), and rather fun twists on the RPG genre. And also, it's now on sale! Not only that, it comes with another one of their games! I reccomend this game to pretty much anyone.
This game is fun. Cthulu is cool.
BUY THIS GAME,  This Game is the best Pixel RPG since Final Fantasy 6, epic story and funny puns a bit grindy at times but never boring.
I used to play games like this on my NES. Things were a lot more harder then cause games were in japanese and I can't even read japanese.
Awesome game, full of humour and a love for Lovecraft's work.
This is just excellent. I love the whole game, the story and the fight system. Must have!
F'taghn. i rate 10 F'taghn out of 10 F'taghn. 10/10 would F'taghn again.
Best. Money. Ever. Spent.  12/10 would hero again.
Cthulhu Saves the World

This is a pretty fun and challenging game. With some good RPG mechanics like the limited number of random battles.  The game also has what is effectivly a new game + mode that gives you all new party members and a variation on the story.  If you can get passed the terrible graphics, this is a fun game.
the game is great. Sure there are other games like the same way, but this one involves a good cthulhu making friends and saving the world!

Classic classic rpg.. for any gameboy rpg fan, this is the game... Definetly reminds of many games lol, from pokemon to finalfantasy.   What makes this game special is the legit humour that permeates the story, beggining to end...   Might get repetitive for those not used to this style of rpg, but the humour might get you through!

Awesome game, way better than Breath of Death VII, funny, not boring at all,never. the perfect game for people who love rpg's, and also for those who don't. if you don't like for the game itself, you will still love all of the jokes. i didnt even get all of them but i still laughed :P    Would i recommend this game? Definatly  8.5/10

This is one of the few indie games I have played, And I think it is absolutely brilliant.  The soundtrack - amazing, spot on OST for an RPG.  The dialogue - funny, sweet and clever, I have wanted to read each bit of text in the game, the alternative developer commentary also gives some good insight as to how each dungeon was made, or the design of certain enemies and boss battles. The combat - Very good. Turn based. Any encounter can be your last. Save often, stock up on potions, choose upgrades wisely, and be ready to have some MP. Enemies can range from 2 at a time, to 6. Possibly more!  Never have I played an indie game like Cthulhu Saves The World before. Seems to be overlooked in every perspective. I would have payed more for this had I known of it before. I picked it up with another game made by the same developer in a bundle for only £0.29. Massive, massive well done to the developer for the design of the game and composition of the amazing soundtrack. 10/10, don't miss out on this game!

A fun (and funny) little parody take on old-school console RPGs. Like RPG tropes? Like HP Lovecraft. Like stupid jokes. Then play this game. The holiday deal gets you this and Breath of Death VI for under a buck (USD), and probably keep you entertained for several hours. The only downside to the games is the repetitive combat, but random encounters stop in any particular area after so many battles, so it's no that bad.
Lot of fun for just a little cash, worth buying.
Ogre Battle 64 + Pokemon Blue = Cthulhu Saves the World.   Play it.

A lovely nostalgic NES-ish RPG featuring our lovable Lovecraft monster, Cthulhu.
Do you wanna have fun? Play this game. Do you like Lovecraft stuff? Play this game. You don't know what to do with your free time? Play this game.  It's awesome, you are not gonna regret it.
Cthulhu does his best to save the world. Why? Play the game and find out, geez... Don't expect me to do everything for you, wow...

Cthulhu Saves the World plays much like the old-school NES and Super NES party-based RPGs, where you control the individual actions of a party of characters in battle. However, unlike a lot of RPGs, it doesn't bog down in a ton of statistical details and lots of different kinds of armor and weapons. Certainly, there are upgrades as you go along, but you don't have to buy a helmet, breastplate, greaves, shield, and boots to defend your character well; it's very much a pick-up-and-play type of RPG. This isn't to say it isn't challenging, however; later battles may drive you nuts until you find just the right party and strategy to succeed. The story is also engaging, and there is a lot of humor throughout. Some conversations are downright funny, and even the narrator gets involved. Character profiles are also winners. One boss is literally a black hole; the profile says, 'Now we're just getting silly.' Don't let the low price tag fool you; Cthulhu Saves the World is a great game.

I personally like this game; it's a pretty nice old fashioned-Indie RPG. The monsters aren't that intricate but it's pretty decent for the type of game it is. Anyone who likes Cthulhu would love this game.

This is actually a pretty great game. At first I looked at it and said to myself 'why waste money on this?' But now I see its not that bad. If you like final fantasy type games or games that sorta break the 4th wall then this game is for you. And in my opinion the characters are pretty funny.
WARNING: This review was written solely for the purpose of getting in on a promotional deal and should not be trusted.  this game is cool

Haven't gotten far into the game, as Hard is actually very difficult, but a good, enjoyable game all the same. Good humor, great music. It's fun.
There is a talking cat FROM SPACE in this game.  10/10

The core gameplay suffers from information overload due to the minimalistic and text-heavy UI. While a little amusing, the writing wasn't super great, either. There were some innovations I respect, but it was a tiring experience.
do you like Cthulhu? of course you do! everyone loves Cthulhu. so you should buy this game!

*is using a controller* *mashes the A button till game starts* *gets in fight* *mashes A button* *wins fight* *gets new party member* *runs around by holding B* *gets in fight* *mashes A button* *wins fight* *continueally gets in fights and just spams A and wins every one of them*  This is a spamming the A button simulator
Funny, simple, and classic. I would recommend to play it on easy mode, because this way you do not have to grind and you can enjoy the funny…

Hilarious, great for the price, and just flat out fun. Turn based combat, familiar to Final Fantasy games, you know, the good ones. The level up system is neat, the comedy pokes fun at other RPGs in the genre and even unexpected games like space invaders. Worth the price completely. Even if you're unaware of Cthulhu lore (like myself) this game is fully enjoyable. Plenty of content, and even some replayability. The game goes on sale for under $5 all the time, it should be a crime to give up a chance to play it.

Like Breath of Death, you can get this game for super, duper cheap and like Breath of Death, it's worth every penny. This game has several play modes for crazy replayability, a polished combat system focusing on quick decisions, but also risk reward mechanics, such as making your enemies stronger but weakening their defense, and a story that is both humrous and endearing. It's the Cthulhu mythos and all things lovecraftian made into a quirky Jrpg and the result is pretty amazing. Also, this game has one of the best things in any Jrpg. The ability to avoid random battles. If you fight a certain number of battles in any dungeon, then you stop getting into random battles. You can choose to grind and fight more, but this feature makes the game so much more enjoyable than your standard Jrpg. Must play.
It's amazing, Fantastic OUTRAGEOUS Get it.

It's awesome. buy it. now.  need a reason? here ya go: 1 It's awesome(duh) 2 texture style from the golden age of gaming 3 YOU'RE A FREAKIN' GOD 4 A FREAKIN' AWESOME GOD 5 epic battles 6 epic bosses 7 epic puns 8 the epic comments 9 and beyond. there's probably a whole bunch awesome stuff I haven't seen yet  seriously. 5 minutes turned into 5 hours in 5 seconds
Get a controller and have fun. Really short though.

it's a werry funy game whit soooooo mutch exploring and adventure... did I mansond the helariousnes of this game. just try it out onec Im soure you dont quit from it for a while Im only recomend this 'peace of awesomnes' :D
An old-school, well done RPG with a great feel and combat system, and a hilarious story.
Rather entertaining and comicalley written. The free dlc that comes with it adds to the gameplay value. A value at the listed price.
Dull. Go get yourself an emulator and play a Final Fantasy numbered lower than seven.
How often do you get the chance to be a great old one, hero, love interest and eight bit superstar? Well here is your chance, buy this game and be an intergalactic rock star.
The Humour... OH THE HUMOUR! Brilliantly written!

Dude, you get this and another RPG, both in one pack, for $3. So evcen if it sucks...  But it doesn't. This game is a retro style RPG (down to the graphics) that is a parody in whole. Yes, there is a story. Kinda.   You know what, screw reviews. Play it for yourself. OBEY.             You're still here? Anyway, I strongly recommend this game.
Very fun cheap game that you can get a couple hours of fun gameplay. It remindes me of pokemon in a way and has a nice playstyle. Good .99 cent game

Highly recommended. It's an old-school 8-bit RPG with alot of humour and a classic vibe to it.  The only cons I have with it are the lack of some options (you have 3 graphic options: fullscreen and 2 fixed window resolutions) and the inventory/party menu that takes a while to get used to.  8.9/10
Awesome idea, rofled my ♥♥♥ off  8/10
Takes the already awesome mechanics and humor of Breath of Death and makes them even better. And at this price, its a steal.

This game should be free on the web, I don't see the point of paying for this. Luckily, I only paid 50 cents, so no big loss. LOL  Don't buy this unless you know H.P. Lovecraft's universe.

Aweful game. it someone gave you the game for free don't take it. it one of those cheap imatation games made with the 'RPG Game Maker'. it trys to imulate final fantasy (the early NES games) but it does a really poor job of it. not many pick up items. a few treasure chest. only saves in save lacations, but claims to save anywhere. you walk around and every no and then you stumble onto a 'Monster' to fight, usualy there are 3 to fight at one time. and each fight you use up your mana which you can only get back on a 'save' spot. you health does fully recover after you win a battle. if you lose you must either retry( from from the last save spot) or restart the game.  I bought this game bundled with another game for under $3,, i want my 3 bucks back...
this game is not for me...3/10.

Very bad game if you can buy it for trading cards.

Cthulhu Saves the World is an old-school JRPG, and by old school, I mean they ditch all modern innovations, ideas and sensibilities the have accumulated over the years. Which is the point, sure, but it just doesn't add up to much these days, unfortunately. The quirky humour occasionally hits its mark and the characters are, at first, a bit more interesting than the usual JRPG trope characters. However, there doesn't seem to be any more to them except the very superficial quirkiness.  Gameplay is the usual old-school JRPG stuff. That is grind. Lots of monotonous grind. In the most baffling design decision I've encountered in a while, your party is completely healed after a won battle, but your mana is not restored. It might not sound so bad, until you realise that without Techs and Magics, your party is consistently and constantly getting beaten. So now you either:   A) have to backtrack to a place where you can restore your mana or  B) win fights without using mana. Which is not happening, not after the first area or so.  Granted, the ability to save anywhere and start random fights almost anytime from the party meny are appreciated, but in the end you still feel like you are wasting your time. The jokes, characters and settings are interesting enough to hold your interest for an hour or two, but eventually the monotony of the gameplay and the frustration of the difficulty curve eat away at your enjoyment.
Ugly (even by SNES standards) uninspired graphics. Funny ironical storyline. Better play a  Final Fantasy  episode on SuperNintendo!
Only for die-hard fans of the genre. Repetitive, meaningless to me.
Cthulhu is a badass. It reminds me of the old JRPGs on gameboy. Final Fantasy for example, it's great.
An excellent well crafted indie RPG, it's a great commentary on old school RPGs and appeals to your sense of nostalgia.
This game is AWESOME!!
Funny 8bit RPG parodying JRPGs. I higly recommend it for it's price. It took me 7hours to beat it I believe.
This is a fun game!  A retro game starring the Dark Lord, Cthulhu on his quest to save the world.  Meet new friends and such. Save maidens beset by monsters. Become a true hero!
Its name says everything :D
This game is worth buying.
Got this game when it was on sale, it was the best 80 cents ive spent all summer.
A fairly fun game at times

Short answer, buy this game if you like turn-based RPGs. It has a decent sense of humor and some good replay value with the several unlockable gameplay modes, one of which has a main story very different from the original. Besides that, it has several great features hopefully more RPGs could adopt.  First feature, everybody gets xp once they join your group, even if they're knocked out or not even in the fight. It annoys me to no end when either of these things are the case. When a character faints and I have to reload just to make sure they aren't left behind xp-wise or the ones I haven't had in the party become nearly useless and end up completely ignored because of the effort it would take to grind them, it really takes me out of the game.   Second, every area has a limit on random encounters. Even the overworld has a limit, though it's very high. If you fight the X amount of mobs in the area shown in your menu then there will be no more random encounters. You can also just continue to spam the button 'Fight' button to run out the random encounters for the entire area. It Makes exploring a dungeon to try and collect all the loot so much less of a hassle. Each area's amount of random encounters worked out pretty well too. I would usually just finish them off or am left with only a few by the end of it. And if you feel the need to grind a bit afterwards, you can still call more mobs from the menu.  Finally, the mobs scale in strength in each area with every fight, peaking by the time you reach the random encounter limit. While the enemies don't scale with each fight in the overworld, they do become stronger for the entirety of the map as you progress through the story.  Those aren't the only great mechanics, just the ones other RPGs don't have but should adopt. Very few complaints otherwise. Mainly just how much of a maze the dungeons can become later in the game. Really worth the small price tag.

This game is just, EPIC.  Awesome for those who like Old school RPG's bunch of funny references, and funny dialogues, I like everything in this game that is supposed to be liked, 10/10 must buy for the price it is!

An excellent pint-sized RPG with some nice humor and interesting gameplay. You really can't go wrong here, considering how cheap it is. Normal difficulty is well-balanced, and the way combat and exploration work avoids a lot of common gameplay frustrations with this style of RPG.
This is an awesome throwback to the 16-bit RPG days. It's fun, funny and an absolute blast. And for its extremely low price, it's a must-buy. Seriously. Buy it. Seriously.
great sense of humor and great gameplay.
It's hilarious! Very tongue-in-cheek and the retro graphics add to the whole atmosphere. And it's cheap!
Cthulhu Saves the World is an old-school rpg, with unique systems and fun story. A Must-have for a RPG fan or anyone who likes comedic games.
funny dialogue, worth it.

Even if my name is longer and i should have won over Cthulhu, i recommend this game.  Why? You can pass under bridge, don't understimate this feature. Brillant and fun dialogues. Pretty long with the bonus modes and the extras. You are Cthulhu. You have magic power. And tentacles. And a sword. And a fangirl. Of course you have a fangirl.  Recommended, just the dialogues are worth the price. If you are a fan of H.P.Lovecraft, it's more recommended (since you get all the quotes).  10/10 would get the world insane again. I mean, save the world again.

The combat is definitely passible, IF you are still cool with old school JRPG combat. I enjoy the 2 choices you get every level to upgrade your character to fill a specific role. I really like how sped up the combat and running is. The refilling health after each fight is nice, as well as the partial mana regen after each fight too(the fewer the turns you take to end a fight, the more mana you gain.)   The leading reason to why this game is great and worth finishing is how hilarious it is start to finish. I hope Zeboyd makes its own games again soon, I don't like the Penny Arcade characters or its humor.
Didn't expect much from this but it turned out to be very witty and fun. The story has a unique charm and the gameplay is basically like any classic turn-based RPG.

Best $3 I've ever spent! This game is a comedic recreation of all those old style RPG's. The dialogue is hilarious, the quotes and references to H.P. Lovecraft (among other stories/myths) are everywhere, and it's cheap!   The director's commentary is a great addition as you get a good amount of insight into small parts of development, but these are implemented throughout the game so well that they do not detriment your enjoyment in gameplay, instead, they actually enhance it.  This game is great! Buy it! :D
was surprised at how good this game is i love it i love it

Hilarious game.  This game has a very good tongue-in-cheek storyline and dialogue to match it. The combat is very well structured and is surprisingly easy to master after a few battles. Strictly in terms of the main storyline quests, CStW lasts a good 10 hours - it took me 12 hours to complete. Some really funny references dotted about too.   This game is a MUST buy, especially for just £2!!  PS: The developer comments are great fun so turn then on.
Save the world so you can destroy it & collect followers along the way while drinking your fill of milk in taverns.  10/10

argh... MY EYES!!!! I SEE IT??? NO! THIS IS NOT TRUE!! THIS IS DREAM. PLZ... KILL ME.... DELITE MY MEMORY. I DESTROY... BUT I... I... I WANT MORE. MORE! YES! I WANT MORE STUPED HUMOR AND tasteless HISTORY! REALY! THIS ONE AND THE SAME TIME AND dumbest , and the best game in the world !!
Absolute blast of a game which has a great mix of humour and very interesting and fun system of combat.

This underated gem is well worth the money. This game consists of silliness, 4th wall breaking, delightful gameplay, amusing characters, an amazing soundtrack, and an interesting array of individual creatures to fight. While it isn't a perfect game, the game doesn't take up a lot of space and it will definately keep you entertained throughout your playthrough. There is one minor complaint that I have and that would be how when you start a new game, the options in order go, normal, easy, hard, insane. Other than that minor nitpicky detail, I honestly cannot complain about this game and I look forward to continuing it.
Well, its Cthulu, Really funny. Buy.
Nice game. Great music, gameplay & story. It's funny and really entertaining. I don't see a reason not to purchase this game. It's also a really good price.
This game is awesome. I do dislike the party system but that's one of the few things I dislike about this game

The saying of looks can be deceiving really applies to this game. On the outside it's a cheap looking 8bit RPG, but on the inside you get an action packed, humour filled adventure that you will never forget. You get all this and Breath of Death VII All for just $2.99! Buy it now, it wil be the best purchase that you ever make! :)
Hilarious game with surprisingly rich combat mechanics -- excellent value for your $$.

Entertaining RPG with a very amusing storyline. Actually made me laugh out loud a lot! If you like Lovecraft, you'll love this game. And even if you don't, you'll still love it, because it is a good game AND a hilarious one.

This game man it's amazing as a professional cultist and follower of Cthulhu this game tells us the struggles of our master and how he was reborn as the almight god we know today.  May Cthulhu devour your soul.
For those of you that love H.P. Lovecraft's stories and Cthulhu Mythos and enjoy JRPGs hands down this is one of the best out there. One of my personal favourite games of all time.
Really fun game, I can't stop playing it.

I'm glad I got it on sale. I'll say that much.  I wanted to like this game. I'm admittedly a pretty big Lovecraftian nerd, and I appreciated the humorous nods towards the mythos. That's...more or less the only positive thing I can say about this game.  The story is garbage, from what little of it I've seen. The gameplay is in a generic turn-based RPG style. The map design is absolutely horrendous. Any stretch of any area looks exactly the same as every other. The tongue-in-cheek humor gets old. Very, very old. The game breaks the fourth wall in the introduction, and proceeds to do it constantly. To an annoying degree. The same jokes that were hardly funny the first time are repeated over and over ad absurdum. It felt like a chore just playing it.  If all of this sounds attractive to you, by all means. Get the game when it's on sale, or something. But I wouldn't recommend paying the full price for it.
Words cannot describe the beauty of this, albeit short, game (I still haven't beaten it, stuck on the boss in the wierd forest area). Just buy. All hail Cthulhu.
'What's more heroic than a squid with a sword...' I don't know but we need more handsome heroes like Cthulhu. Also 10/10
Great game. For the price? Absolutely.

Entertaining old school homage to the 16-bit JPRGs of the early 1990s. Challenging, MegaTen-esque combat and a ludicrous storyline with lots of humorous references. Any fan of the RPG genre should give this a try. It's only freaking US$3, and you get two games in one.
An absolute blast with a battle system that trumps any and all old school RPGs and a sense of humor that trumps most game's (humor) in general.

I ended up playing this on my phone rather than my computer, but it's a fun little game that encompasses the spirit and mechanics of old jrpgs and the like. A little cheeky, even. I recommend this game, especially at this price.
This is a fun little RPG. If you don't like to play the same game for 100 hours and want some humor in your game, this is for you. Evidently it took me about 15 hours to beat, and I'm very thourough.
It's an adventure game featuring Cthulhu as the main protagonist. What more do you want?

Well... When I started this game I wasn't expecting much out of it. xD glad I decided to get it anyway. This turned out to be a very hilarious and addicting experience. A great retro styled rpg with a story that is guranteed to make you laugh.

Probably one of the best 16-bit era JPRPG style game for modern gamers. The fighting system and mechanics are solid and have an interesting ramping system that shows the developers put a lot of thought behind which systems were great from old JRPGs and which ones should be thrown out for something better.

This is one of my favorite Indie RPG's because it knows when to borrow from formula and when to depart from it.  Chiefly -- the battle system is actually interesting. Enemies get stronger each round, so you have a built-in timer that keeps you from just turtling and healing. Another cool thing is that Cthulhu has an 'insane' status he can inflict with one of his attacks, that makes enemies more vulnerable but also makes them more dangerous, which is a cool risk tradeoff.  Outside of battle, you have a a random encounter quota that caps out, so if you clear a dungeon of enemies, you don't have to fight any more and can freely explore. Also, you can trigger fights at any time if you want to grind a bit, so you don't even have to waste time running around waiting for them to happen. Very streamlined, in a good way.  And of course the goofy characters and premise are really enjoyable. Basically this little gem is a master class in how to update a classic formula into something that's appetizing to the modern gaming palate.  (My playtime hours are low because I originally played this game off of Steam)

Surprised on the quality of the story telling. The writers did put alot of effort into the humour that really exceed my initial expectation of the title.   The title really undersell the quality of combat and the plot
A step up in quality in every aspect from Breath of Death VII. Highly recommended if you like the genre.

I bought the game because it was on offer and I like the old school rpg games like FF in gameboy. At first it seems quite promising. Many monsters, many spells, and 7 characters. From the other side, the world map is small and the game loses the difficulty when you reach level 50. But it cost 2€ and i recommend it if you want to spend a couple hours of fun. :)
It's a funny rpg game that is amazing: taking Chulhu and an rpg, thats gold!
Really tongue in cheek classice RPG. Just about the right length. I was amused at how spot on some of the music was.
I love this game. It's a total flash back to SNES RPGs.
very good game!!funny too!!!
Awesome game, very fun and long. Pretty funny too
100% pure win
10/10 for groupie, rockstar relationships.

A interesting premise and a elder god as a main character CstW does things a bit different, insanity becomes part of your tactics in battle as enemies change their attacking styles when they are insane. Overall, fun RPG if you like them.
Its a 'grind like hell to level up' game, if you don't like it, tuff ♥♥♥♥♥♥s
Reminded me of why I love classic style RPGs. :D Totally worth the price, and then some!

Parody/horror/old-style RPG. There is everything here. Action, romance, funny (really!) jokes and sexy Cthulhu. On the other side, after playing for few hours, game becomes boring and jokes aren't funny anymore. Still, game is good and worth of bying.

If saving the day and being the Hero wasn't enough!? How about being super badass Cthulhu and save the world just to destroy it!! The narrating and characteristic sense of humor this game has. 10/10 would Cthulhu!
Very awesome console-style rpg!
zelda mixed with final fantasywith a cthulhu twist
Awesome graphics, fast paced gameplay, incredible cutscenes, you even get to walk underneath bridges! Incredible  10/10 would become octopus/dragon man again
If you happen to love Lovecraft, play this. Period.
Cheap, funny and addicting. Deffinetly give it a go!
Funniest ♥♥♥♥ take game ever. Cthulhu is amazing. The sly digs at all RPG's is amazing. Cthulhu Fhtaghn!
Do you like H.P. Lovecraft? Then this self-parody RPG is up your alley. It controls great, and the battle system is fantastic.

Hilarious game. Play it for the character interactions though. Don't spend so much time trying to get everything or bother clicking on every pot/dresser. There really is nothing in them (although some of the dialog is pretty good when you try). I wish I would have spent maybe 2/3 the amount of time playing this game but my completionist mentality always gets the better of me even though I never 100% a game anyways. I think I would have enjoyed the story more had i done so.
Final fantacy turned on its head lol
Wat.
If you like old school RPG mechanics and funny writing then play this game right now. It's cheap and totally worth it.

If you like old 16 bit games then this is the game for you. I totally like the old classic games like this one. I highly recommend this game. This is seriously one of the best and fun game i've played in months. Its even better then cod. Nice storyline and much more. You should totally try this classic

Culhu saves the world is a remarkable Lovecraftian masterpiece of a game. There is the humourous descriptions of H.P. Lovecraft's books in the Miscatonic University, and the hilariou dialouge between the narrator and Cthulhu himself. Definately a game worth buying.

PROS: - Very good game for the money. - Old school - Massive amounts of enemies. - Levels scale well. - Comedic storyline. - Addicting - Level perks to choose from every level (Increase HP or Stats? Learn a spell or passive ability?)  CONS: - Dungeons are way too long, multi-path puzzle dungeons. - Can only buy weapons/armor, cannot buy potions/1-Ups. - Some bosses early on is difficult. - A lot of grinding necessary.  FINAL THOUGHTS: I beat this game in around 13 hours with a lot of grinding, I got it for 98 cents on sale so it was worth the money...even at normal price its worth the money. The grinding was surprisingly fun(I listed it as a con because a majority of people dont like grinding), and the amount of spells leaves you constantly looking for better ways to defeat your enemies, although a lot of spells become obsolete, some spells you get early on can still be used at end-game for enemy ailments(such as Blind or Stun). Overall its worth it, make sure you get the combo pack that includes Breath of Death VII.

It's funny. It's short. It's funny... But it also gets so repetetive and un-rewarding that you have enough after - let's say - an hour or so... So if it cost 0.50 Euro (Sale) or so, and you need something to play for such a short time, go and buy it... But pls don't expect thst it will keep you playing longer than an hour, maybe two.
Freaking Cool
THE BEST indie RPG game ever! a MUST play, highly recommended!
Look at this title and ask yourself 'why do I not own this game?'
Hilariously funny game, great if you want to kill time, and love classic styled RPGs.
is rly good

I know it just seems like a quick, cheap joke game. And it is. But it's also one of the best old school JRPGs to come out in the last ten years, and one of the only ones available on PC. If you enjoy JRPGs at all, I can't emphasize enough, buy it immediately.
Great RPG for RPG fans everywhere! Tons of nostalgia, too!
This is old school rpg goodness!
Great RPG, very much like the old school NES RPG's. Great Writing.
SNES-style satirical JRPG that tastes great and is easy to swallow.

Classic-style RPG from the 8-16bit era, really funny storyline, and a relatively unique battle style make this game a throwback with a modern polishing. It's super cheap too, which helps. Anyone who loves old school RPGs has got to pick this up.

I thought I wasn't going to like it. But from starting to trying it today I've been playing none stop for almost 3 hours. It's old class grafics wich I grew up with and learned to love. N I found out I still love it very much and it has humor in it!

really cool classic rpg. Nice told and funny story, good game balance and a perfect retro feeling (nice graphics and a great soundtrack). finished the game in two days. hope the developer make another one in the near future !
HP Lovecraft would be appalled. You, however, will be pleased, if you're a JRPG fan.
Cthulhu didn't save the world. Maybe that's because I didn't finish the game.
Pixels? Check. Turn based combat? Check. Comedy? Check. Terrible monstrosities that make you question your sanity and lead you to the very gates of madness? Check.
This game is a fun little RPG. I was very pleased with it.
Come on. For under $3, this is worth playing even for an hour just to laugh at the jokes! Very entertaining!

Great RPG that is reminiscent of the classic nes/snes RPGs. The game takes a satirical look at the genre, and pokes fun at many of the genre's cliches. With numerous different challenge modes this game has a large amount of replayability.

Cthulhu is a parody that manages to succeed not only with its humor but also with its gameplay. It manages to capture the essence of old school JRPGs while avoiding some of their pitfalls. It's got the music, the graphics, and the interface that we all remember, but with the added bonus of capping random encounters in an area. Leveling and encounters are fast, without fiddly little things that can bog a game down. Besides that, you can't beat the price. Hours of fun for less than a dollar - sign me up!
This game is awesome! It Has hilarious Diaolgue, very well written. I would play this game just for the chat sequences. Cthulhu Requires Groupies!!!

The lord of insanity, Cthulhu was all set to plunge the world into insanity and destruction when his powers were sealed by a mysterious sorcerer. The only way for him to break the curse is to become a true hero. Save the world to destroy it in an epic parody RPG journey of redemption, romance, and insanity! This game is amazing. It's rare to find a game that is both entertaining and genuinely funny. Plenty of 4th wall breaks, hilarious commentary and great retro graphics. Also Cthulhu looks like Dr. Zoidburg.
It's basically the best, and ♥♥♥♥, it was .99 cents!
This game is hilarious and excellent. A must-have for all lovers of the JRPG genre and style of the games of our youth.
Great game. The combat style is very interesting, the battles can be quick and easy, but the game will sometimes throw a curveball where you get hit with a battle that is pretty challenging.
Amusing little rpg, really can't wait to spend more time on it.

Please play this game. It's fantastic. Everything you could ask for in a retro RPG: it has witty character dialogue and clever puns everywhere! I love the battle system and it definitely has replay value. Also, it has many clever references to other games and movies and such. It's a fantastic game and everyone should play it.
The humour in this RPG is fantastic. Turns the hero saves the day stigma right on its head. A required purchase
A wonderful tribute to the 16-bit era JRPG games. This game is fun to play, and has a lot of great humor to it. Well worth the price to get both it and Breath of Death VII.

Fun and fresh parody-ish take on the typical 2d, random encounter RPG with alot of weird things going on. such as a badass tentacleface who is actually doing something good in order to retrieve his powers so that he can do bad things.
This one surely is better than the previous part. Storyline is more interesting, but still - don't bother to play it if you don't have a rigid patience towards 'Gameboy Pokemon' style battles.

i was like 'well another cheap game where i can sell the cards and hope for a booster pack someday to make profit. also just looks nice if you own more games'. the time it takes to get all cards (1-2 hours) i always play the game. to be fair this game is kinda nice. it is funny and a normal rpg (nothing special here) but it has some nice humor. if you just want another game and sell the cards, or you dont cry about 29cents, play it its fun!  also you get a 2nd game i didnt play yet but as far as i know its the game they made before this one. so should be fun aswell

This game is awesome: -Funny(checked) -Interesting storyline(checked) -Awesome caracters(checked) -Low price(checked) And you are Cthulhu who tries to save the world so he can destroy it after,what do you want more?
Awesome dialogue and great characters! The only con if anything was the mazes. (some of them took me hours to get out off/progress in the game). Other than that, this game is great for its price!

You get to play as Cthulhu, some chick with a tentacle-face obsession, an animated sword, a necromancer from the cult of Cthulhu, and Cthulhu's evil space cat who is totally not a cat.  11/10 would fhtagn again.  SERIOUS REVIEW TIME!  CSTW seems to be built around its combat system. It's got some unique features that sets it apart from your average JRPG. One is the combo system. Each attack is worth a certain number of hits, and each hit landed increases your combo counter. You can consume your combo counter with certain finishers that deal a lot of damage, plus even more damage based on your combo count. Personally, I found that its relevance faded as the game progressed.  Also present is a soft enrage system. Every turn you spend in the same fight, the enemies get 10% stronger. This forces you to optimize your damage per turn.  There's also a nice design feature in its random encounters; once you fight a certain number of battles in an area, you stop getting random encounters there. You can still manually fight enemies in an area as much as you want, but there's no need to, even on hard mode. (Insane mode, however, is a totally different story.)  Aside from that, the game is a huge parody of JRPGs in general. You'll see what I mean as you play it.  As my recommendation implies, I had fun with it. It was 15 hours long for me.

This game is basically the same as Breath of Death VII. RPG-lite with quick turn-based combat, minimal resource management, and a simplistic light-hearted story sprinkled with puns. You fully heal HP after every fight and the game emphasizes on quickly finishing fights by making enemies stronger over each round and giving you more MP restoration for battles that end in a few turns. Forced random encounters in each zone are limited so if you run that number out you don't have to fight anymore in that zone unless you choose to. The music in this one was actually pretty good in some places, and as with BoDVII you can conveniently remap the controls to work on one hand so you can relax or eat something while you play. I accrued about 8 hours of playtime and did a few extra dungeons. Not a bad game, especially since its comes pretty cheap.

Did you grow up in the era where JRPs were the only decent RPGs on console systems? If names like Breath of Fire, Suidoken, Star Ocean and the like bring a warm feeling in your belly, then see a doctor. However, if the elicit a response of joy and fond after school memories, then I highly reccommend this game. I've been sick this week, and spent it playing this game, it reminded me of being sick as a kid and playing FF7, again.  Zeboyd clearly made this game for fans of those games, but for those who don't have 40+ hours to spend trying to kill Ruby Weapon or get the damned golden chocobo. Clocks in at about 10-12 hours, and it can be a challenge if you try to speed through it. One boss, had me using all my potions and I barely survived.. The random battles can be frustrating, but luckily, after you reach x amount in a given area, the random battles stop. Not only that, but it is pretty funny to boot. Not bad for the two man team known as Zeboyd!

A budget indie throwback at the old 8-bit JRPGs we grew up on. The game was comical and even streamlined the olden genre of games so it wouldn't be painful to play today. I would recommend this light title.
The humor in this game is outstanding and it's not at the expense of the gameplay despite the retro graphics. I enjoy the rare addition of the developers' commentary as well.

This classic little game is a homage to the oldschool jRPG's with an awesome twist. YOU ARE GOD DAMNED CTHULHU THAT'S WHAT!   Hilarity ensues as you battle it out on this pixelated RPG; Cthulhu has lost all of his spacemagic and has to prove himself to the narrator as a TRUE HERO in order to regain his lost power or some jive... the narrator is a gentlemanly ♥♥♥♥ most of the time to Cthulhu ;~; How can you do that to him!? Poor Cthulhu..,  The Lord of Insanity surely is not pleased, but you would have to be a really horrible person to not like Cthulhu.  'Effing F'thang!  We were all doomed anyway, but none so sweet as being doomed by Cthulhu.
Have you met our lord and savior, Cthulhu? If not, you'd best play this game!
The humor is great 9/10

From the start, it looked better than it's predecessor, BoD VII. That's probably the reason behind all those positive reviews on Steam and anywhere else. It looks like SNES JRPG, and it has Cthulhu. AND it breaks the fourth wall like two minutes into the game! 9 out of 10! Both the Cthulhu mythos and the JRPG genre are so clichéd they beg to be parodied. Unfortunately, just throwing both into the mix isn't enough to make it amusing for more than half an hour. The game itself has so many little flaws left from BoD VII it makes itself a painful experience instead of a little amusing joke. It's probably worth the 23 cents I've spent on it, but not the time spent.
ALL HAIL THE ALL MIGHTY CTHULHU
ITS A FREAKIN' SKELETOR RPG...I MEAN YOU PLAY AS A GIANT SQUID BUT HE ACTS JUST LIKE SKELETOR, ITS THE BEST THING IN THE HISTORY OF ANYTHING EVER.
Hillarious,Funny,Weird,You MUST Play this game It has Cthulhu For ♥♥♥♥'s sake.....

If you're reading this, I assume you've also checked the page for Breath of Death VII. I got both of the games in a bundle, and this is my take on the two. They're great. I'm not really a fan of the turn-based rpg genre, but BoDVII eased me into the combat style and CStW expanded upon it wonderfully. If you get both I would recommend playing BoDVII first. What you may be asking is what the difference between the two is.  BoDVII is shorter. It took me about 4 hours to complete once, whereas CStW took me 10. BoDVII however has more believable characters and story. CStW's characters are cheesy and really insincere in comparison, and they literally have to break the fourth wall in order to make the plot work. BoDVII may have been shorter, but it was just the right length. CStW was longer, but the length feel like its there just so there can be more of it, not to expand upon the quality of the game in any way. It has more content, but doesn't do much with it. CStW's combat system is better though. It is much more complex and features the ability to put different party members into your fighting group of 4. BoDVII only had 4 party members.  Final Verdict: Breath of Death VII and Cthulhu Saves the World are both amazing games. If I had to pick one over the other, I would choose BoDVII. If you can geth both though, do it, they're cheap.
The premise is cute. If you are already into the idea of becoming Cthulhu go for it, but I find I have to be in a certain kinda mood to play this kinda game.
Great. Cyber cats. Octodad's big brother.. and a lustful fan of tentacles. Tentacle skills. Got it for dirt cheap, you get it for dirt cheap, too.  8.5/10
Worth buying, the beautiful game, for sure.
Old-school RPG of the decade ! You can take my word on it.

One of the best comedy RPG`s. The quests thou classic RPG lot is backed up by some of the best comedic written lines in history making them quite unique. As we follow Cthulhu and his merry fans on the quest to become heroes and fight the classic share of RPG stereotype heroes and monsters we rescue dogs from dangerous caves and other many other HEROIC actions. Classic turn based system thou outdated serves well here being a simple yet efficient combat system that makes sure the flow of battles don`t spoil the story. One of the best comedy games ever released. A must have for fans of parodies and even JRPG fans that are looking for something....different.

A very nice 16-bit style RPG. Good humor is sprinkled all over this game, both in the plot and in the random things that occur in the game. The soundtrack is amazing - power metal riffs with trumpets for extra epicness are the best thing that can happen to a boss battle. Every gravestone has a writing, every cabinet has a description of what's on it. I recomment playing with the director's commentary. All hail Cthulhu.

***OMG this is a Cult Classic!*** ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- PROS: .PIXEL ART .EPIC MUSIC: That I hummed for weeks .INTERESTING STORY: The title says it all! .LOVECRAFT LOVE: All your favourite uncomprehensible Lovecraft gods are plain as you can see!  .DEVELOPER COMMENTARY: The developer explains the dev process. A good lesson on game design. .BEAUTIFUL CULTURAL REFERENCES: The first boss says it all.  CONS: .REPETITIVE: A bit grindy and high encounter rates .BASIC DUNGEON EXPLORATION: The most you'll get at the early stages is stairs. .LACK OF CUSTOMISATION: Pick 2 abilities every so often. And only 2 gear slots?!
Cthulhu saved my world!

I loved this.  Pound for Pound one of the best RPG's available.    If you like RPGs, Lovecraftian Stories, Or just looking for a half decent cheap game, pick this up. If you like all 3 of those things, what are you waiting for? Cthulhu Calls!
This is great game. If you are looking for a cheap rpg that is actually good then this is it.

A great deal of fun. A touch repetetive but you're given a generous amount of power. Most fights you have 3 options, evade (and miss out on exp) or attack smartly, or attack using a few general purpose, overpowered attacks. Doingit smart ends the fight quicker by a large margin, fyi.  Additionally, a lot of fun humour in this little ditty.

A quaint and enjoyable game with a couple of hang ups.  This game is worth its price point. I believe even if that $3 was for this game alone it might be worth it. It has witty dialogue for the most part and does not attempt to over stay its welcome with the very basic and slightly unenticing story that it has.  Overall this game is a breeze and will be fairly enjoyable if slightly repetative.  Pros: Witty Dialogue  Alot of characters to choose from  Fairly short RPG  Cons: Dungeons are repetative  Fights are also very rinse repeat and due to the frontal view of fighting it can become very boring as the animations for the players enjoyment are minimal.  Ultimately its cheap and enjoyable I would put it at a 6/10 for someone who knows nothing of Love Craft and 6.5/10 for someone who will get more of the jokes.

Engaging, immersive, and entertaining jrpg-like that fulfills all of the common tropes laid down by classics like Dragon Question/Final Fantasy while maintaining an approachable playability shared by the group's other title, Breath of Death VII. While even on normal mode certain fights are a challenge, the game can be played through without too much overrarching strategy or focus, making it a comfortable game to play recreationally and for the pure humor and enjoyment it provides.   Solid game, would recommend to pretty much anyone, would buy at far more than full price for the quality of the title.

This game is funny and has its moments but I put not recommended because theres too much rpg walking, the maps aren't obvious to navigate, its designed to be difficult to remember so you get lost multiple times doing something simple, some of their jokes are at lacks of good content or distractions from actual story, and its not obvious that you can walk under bridges or ramps so you back track repeatedly wondering if you missed something. And even then its alot of the same old boring tiles. Buy it if you like free rpg games that are poorly made. I mean it has novelty yeah but when theres other games I can play I don't wanna waste my time here that often walking back and forth five times lost.
Absolutely love it, wonderfully nostalgic and hilarious.

So I finally sat down and beat this game after being saved outside of Ry'leh for quite some time. This game is awesome, especially when you consider I got for like $1 or something ridiculously cheap.   Worth so much more than $1 or 2 or whatever. If you love classic style, turn-based RPGs, you'll love this game. Its got humor....hell it's got Cthulu!
Old-style, Grindy, Fun. And cheap.
This is an accessible, charming RPG. It's a little goofy, but that's the idea. Plus, the mechanics of the game are really solid. It's a great game for when you just want to unwind.
One of my all time favorite games. The story is well writen and packed with humor, it's a throwback to old RPGs, and there's replayability as well! In my books it's 10/10

This game doesn't aim to have the best gameplay ever, nor does it want to compete for the best looks. It does, however, want to take most 'must be done in a game' events and tear them down, laugh at them evily or otherwise transmute them in a funny way.  The pros, for me, are: a nice twist of the classical turn-based rpg fights; a nice old-school graphical chart; good humor and a funny plot; and very price-effective.  Should I try to find some cons, they would be: some predictability in the plot, the combat system can be off-putting for casual play.

Like Breath of Death VII, the gameplay features some really nice ideas (like the unite skills, combo boost, random encounter limit, level-up choices and enemy strength progression during battle) that I liked a lot. And again great humour in the dialogues!  (Well, exploring all corners oft he dungeon labyrinths would actually be rather annoying without the encounter limit)  One should also mention the joy of walking under bridges :-) But seriously, nice engine upgrade, and some interesting developer commentary.  Cool bonus modes (NG+)
A good game, humor is well placed and good music. I have nothing bad to say about this game pick it up the value is amazing for the length of the story.
